epistemic_note: This analysis identifies which sensory modalities the grammar RELIES ON (presupposes), not which it ENCODES (specifies).

phase1.name: Hazard-Context Discrimination Load
phase1.question: Do discrimination problems cluster near olfactory-dependent contexts?
phase1.interpretation: ENERGY domain (olfactory) has 8.7x discrimination vs FREQUENT (visual) at 2.5x. Section H diversity (585) highest. Discrimination load correlates with olfactory-dependent contexts.

phase2.name: HT-Sensory Correlation
phase2.question: Does HT density correlate with olfactory discrimination difficulty?
supporting_evidence: C477: HT correlates with rare MIDDLEs (r=0.504)
C459: HT rises BEFORE high-stress sections
Rare MIDDLEs require learned olfactory discrimination
phase2.interpretation: HT-MIDDLE correlation (r=0.504) exceeds threshold (0.3). HT marks contexts requiring careful sensory discrimination, consistent with olfactory being the hard-to-read modality.

phase3.name: Kernel-Sensory Mapping
phase3.question: Do k-adjacent vs h-adjacent contexts show different profiles?
phase3.interpretation: k-adjacent (ENERGY): 40.5 MIDDLEs/1000. h-adjacent (FREQUENT): 46.3 MIDDLEs/1000. Difference: 5.8. Distinct discrimination profiles support different affordance presuppositions.

phase4.name: LINK vs Non-LINK Affordance Profile
phase4.question: Do waiting contexts presuppose different affordances than acting?
phase4.interpretation: LINK (waiting) shows lower MIDDLE turnover (repetitive visual/thermal). Non-LINK (acting) shows higher turnover (46.26/1000 vs 40.48/1000). Consistent with olfactory discrimination during action phases.

phase5.name: Negative Sensory Control (Visual-Only)
phase5.question: Can visual observation alone explain the discrimination architecture?
phase5.interpretation: Observed ENERGY MIDDLEs (564) is 11.3x higher than visual-only maximum (50). VISUAL-ONLY FAILS. Olfactory affordance is NECESSARY by exclusion.

phase6.name: Instrumentation Resolution Assessment
phase6.question: Does discrimination require instrument-aided precision?
phase6.interpretation: MIDDLE distribution is CATEGORICAL (CV=5.83, top 10% = 84.3%). Human senses suffice for categorical discrimination.
